S31640-018_syn_1:
Indication: Benign tracheal stenosis.
Proc: Flex bronch, mechanical debulking.
Findings: 65% stenosis mid-trachea (scar/granulation).
Action: Forceps removal, snare of fibrotic ridge.
No balloon, no ablation.
Result: Mild residual narrowing.
S31640-018_syn_2:
PROCEDURE: Bronchoscopic management of benign tracheal stenosis.
FINDINGS: Post-intubation scarring and granulation tissue narrowing the mid-trachea.
TECHNIQUE: Mechanical excision was performed. Granulation tissue was avulsed using biopsy forceps. A distinct fibrotic ridge was resected using an electrosurgical snare. No balloon dilation or thermal ablation was required to achieve satisfactory patency.
S31640-018_syn_3:
Billing Code: 31640.
Diagnosis: Benign Tracheal Stenosis.
Technique: Excision of tracheal tissue (scar/granulation) using forceps and snare.
Note: This is coded as excision (31640) rather than dilation (31630) or ablation (31641) because the primary method was removal of tissue.

Patient: [REDACTED], 44-year-old female
MRN: [REDACTED]
Date: [REDACTED]
Location: [REDACTED]
Attending: Dr. Henry Wallace

Indication:
Benign post-intubation tracheal stenosis with exertional dyspnea.

Procedure:
Flexible bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of granulation tissue and scar (CPT 31640).

Anesthesia / Sedation:
Moderate sedation with midazolam and fentanyl, topical lidocaine. Native airway. ASA class II.

Findings:
Short-segment circumferential granulation and scar in mid-trachea narrowing lumen by ~65%.

Interventions:
Mechanical debulking done with forceps to remove granulation tissue; snare resection of a fibrotic ridge. No balloon dilation, no ablation. Tracheal lumen improved to mild residual narrowing.

Hemostasis:
Minimal oozing controlled with cold saline.

EBL:
5 mL.

Complications:
None.

Disposition:
Discharged home after observation; plan for repeat bronchoscopy and possible balloon dilation in future if restenosis occurs.
